intro: Psychotria dichotoma, commonly known as the "devil's breath" or "soul's breath," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has been used in traditional medicine and spiritual practices.
